Iranian Diplomats Help Korean Farmers 
    Sinchon, May 13 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Jalaleddin Namini Mianji and staff members of the Iranian embassy here Friday visited the DPRK-Iranian Friendship Saenal Farm in South Hwanghae Province to help its members in farming on the occasion of the week of DPRK-Iranian friendship.
 The guests helped the farmers in weeding a maize field.
 Then they enjoyed an art performance given by kindergarteners of the farm and talked with farmers, deepening the friendship.
 The ambassador noted that the DPRK has achieved many successes in the land realignment, in the efforts to implement the policy to bring about a radical turn in seed improvement and the double-cropping under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il. He wished the farmers success in their drive this year when all efforts are focused on successfully doing the farm work.    
 The friendly relations between Iran and the DPRK are growing stronger as the days go by, he added.    
 That day staff members of the embassy handed over aid materials they had prepared with sincerity to the farm.

Foreign Delegations and Delegates Here
    Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Delegations  and delegates of Malaysia, Thailand, Romania, Sweden and Britain arrived here by air today to participate in the 8th Pyongyang International Commodity Fair.
 Chinese delegations arrived here yesterday by train.
